perturbation.original_text:
g)   "User Data" shall mean all information regarding an individual Program           Member, as further broken into these distinct categories:

       i)   "URS User Data" shall mean those data elements that are captured                in the Excite@Home primary registration system via the                Excite@Home Member registration form that is most commonly                provided to new Excite@Home Members. URS User Data shall at a                minimum include user-supplied ZIP Code, gender, date of birth,                deliverable email address, and original Excite@Home registration                date.
perturbation.changed_text:
g)   "User Data" shall mean only the purchase history of an individual Program Member, tracked through the Co-Branded Application.

       i)   "URS User Data" shall mean those data elements that are captured                in the Excite@Home primary registration system via the                Excite@Home Member registration form that is most commonly                provided to new Excite@Home Members. URS User Data shall at a                minimum include user-supplied ZIP Code, gender, date of birth,                deliverable email address, and original Excite@Home registration                date.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'User Data' is changed to only include purchase history, which conflicts with the more detailed description within 'URS User Data' that references registration information. This creates an in-text contradiction, as 'User Data' is defined narrowly at first but then expanded upon in its sub-categories, potentially leading to disputes about what data is actually covered under the term.

perturbation.original_text:
a)   For the first page presented within any shopping category area,

       i)   All Targeted Offers shall have placement priority above any                Untargeted Offers.

       ii)  Within the Targeted Offers region, the top 30% of the offer                placement locations on the first page within a category of the                Co-Branded Application (not including banner or sponsorship                placements) will be allocated to Excite@Home exclusive                e-centives offers. The remaining 70% of such first pages, along                with subsequent pages within each category, the offer placement                locations will be split 50%/50% between Excite@Home and
            e-centives and will be served in an alternating order.

       iii) Similarly, within the Untargeted Offers region, the top 30% of                the offer placement locations on the first page within a                category of the Co-Branded Application (not including banner or                sponsorship placements) will be allocated to Excite@Home. The                remaining 70% of such first pages, along with subsequent pages                within each category, the offer placement locations will be                split 50%/50% between Excite@Home and e-centives and will be                served in an alternating order.
perturbation.changed_text:
a)   For the first page presented within any shopping category area,

       i)   All Targeted Offers may or may not have placement priority above any                Untargeted Offers.

       ii)  Within the Targeted Offers region, the top 10% of the offer                placement locations on the first page within a category of the                Co-Branded Application (not including banner or sponsorship                placements) will be allocated to Excite@Home exclusive                e-centives offers. The remaining 50% of such first pages, along                with subsequent pages within each category, the offer placement                locations will be split 70%/30% between Excite@Home and
            e-centives and will be served in an alternating order.

       iii) Similarly, within the Untargeted Offers region, the top 50% of                the offer placement locations on the first page within a                category of the Co-Branded Application (not including banner or                sponsorship placements) will be allocated to Excite@Home. The                remaining 20% of such first pages, along with subsequent pages                within each category, the offer placement locations will be                split 90%/10% between Excite@Home and e-centives and will be                served in an alternating order.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the specifics of offer placement creates ambiguity. The original text ensures that Targeted Offers always appear above Untargeted Offers. Changing this language to 'may or may not' allows for the placement to be decided on a case-by-case basis, or the specifics between the percentages of distribution is changed so that it allows more for Excite@Home.

perturbation.original_text:
18.  CONFIDENTIALITY

  a)   For the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" means           information about the disclosing party's (or its suppliers') business           or activities that is proprietary and confidential, which shall           include all business, financial, technical and other information of a           party marked or designated by such party as "confidential" or           "proprietary"; or information which, by the nature of the           circumstances surrounding the disclosure, ought in good faith to be           treated as confidential.
perturbation.changed_text:
18.  CONFIDENTIALITY

  a)   For the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" means ONLY the specific pricing terms agreed upon within this contract.  All other business or technical information is explicitly excluded from this definition, regardless of any markings or designations otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Confidential Information' is broad, covering a wide range of proprietary data. By restricting it to 'only the specific pricing terms,' a significant contradiction is introduced. Later sections of the agreement may rely on the broader definition, leading to disputes over what information is actually protected under the confidentiality clause.
